--- Edward Alexander <edyhiphop@...> wrote:

> 
> Hey guys.....
> Sorry cuz I didn't respond to any message because
> I'm busy with school. I'm asking for something. I
> need it at History....... Can you give me some
> information about battle maps???? I mean, just like
> in WWII. Maps of the area where the battles took
> place.

Edy--

Hi Eddy and everybody

Sorry I have not been around for a while, my work on the Shimabara Rebellion and the graphic works on the "heradry" have taken longer that anticipated (plus other thing getting in the way!!)

So Battle Maps; as Nate replied all depends on your interest... However, I could point you to a couple of the Osprey Series, reasonably cheap and readily available. The two are Nagashino 1575, by Stephen Turnbull, and Sekigahara 1600, by "our own" Anthony Bryant. Both have reasonable two dimentional maps and excellent 3D section maps. Good as a starter?

Cheers,
                    Rod :-)
